FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions

Before the day

Things to know leading up to the Partner Symposium

  • Location of the event

  • We are thrilled to safely resume in-person events, and we are adhering to the DC public health requirements and our medical advisor’s advice for the Partner Symposium.

    • Everyone should take a rapid COVID-19 test the morning of the event before departing home or your hotel. If you need a rapid test, email staffnews@wwfus.org.
    • If you feel unwell or test positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday, stay at home.
    • If you feel unwell at the event, you should promptly leave, self-isolate, and prioritize getting tested for COVID-19.
    • Decisions to wear masks or physically distance will be respected. If you forget a mask, we’ll have some at the registration desk.
    • The venue has ample outdoor spaces to get fresh air.
    • Hand sanitizing stations are throughout the space.
    • If you test positive for COVID-19 in the days following the event, please inform your HR business partner.

  • If you have additional questions, please email partners@wwfus.org

Day 1

Things to know for day one...

  • Location of the event

  • Venue

  • A first aid facility is available next to the entrance where you came in (called the “Premium Entry”) and will be staffed all day.

Day 2

Things to know for day two...

Other questions about the WWF Partner Symposium

  • No, this will be in person only.
